problems_solutions.problem: External recruiting for sales roles is ineffective and time-consuming
problems_solutions.solution: Use personal networks and referrals for sales hiring
steps: Leverage personal network from previous companies
Ask for referrals from high performers

problems_solutions.problem: Companies are in demand-poor environments with insufficient new opportunities
problems_solutions.solution: Shift focus from pipeline conversion to demand generation
steps: Audit how much time reps spend on new opportunity creation
Reallocate resources from conversion optimization to demand gen
Increase customer-facing time for sales reps

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Using external recruiters to source sales talent
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Longer hiring process, inferior candidate pool, higher risk of bad hires, more time spent overall
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Build and leverage personal networks, use employee referrals, focus on candidates where reputation precedes them
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Every sales resume from recruiters claims 'top 5%, President's Club, 180% to quota' but top performers don't use external recruiters

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Focusing primarily on existing pipeline conversion instead of demand generation
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Limited growth potential, revenue dependent on closing existing deals, missed opportunities for faster growth
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Prioritize creating new opportunities, increase customer-facing time, focus on demand until you have too much
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Sales reps spending most time following up on old opportunities instead of creating new ones

growth_tactics.tactic: Build referral networks for sales hiring
